abstract:
Handle easily all those timezone issues your system knows about. Fear
those it doesn't.

*Tags:* Data Science, Science

Scheduled on `wednesday 16:00 </schedule/#wed-16:00-media>`__ in room
media
description:
On the last Sunday of October “we get one more hour of sleep” but may
spend much more time debugging code dealing with the timezones, daylight
saving time shifts and datetime stuff in general.

We'll look at a few pitfalls you may encounter when working with
datetimes in Python. We'll discover the ``pytz`` module and explain why
``pytz.all_timezones`` contains over 500 individual timezones. We'll
also find the reason why ``pytz`` is not part of the standard Python,
why it gets updated so often and why even that won't solve all your
problems.
title: A Day Has Only 24±1 Hours: import pytz
